text: By Securities and Exchange Commission of Sri Lanka Sustainable Financing Sustainable finance refers to any form of financial service integrating Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) criteria into the business or investment decisions for the lasting benefit of both clients and society at large. Presently, a number of securities regulators are focused on whether the sustainable finance claims are accurate and whether investors have the information they need to evaluate sustainable finance products. Retail investors, in particular, need to be able to easily understand the characteristics of such products, as well as the associated risks, to support a more informed investment decision-making process. Recent developments pertaining to sustainable finance in the emerging markets; Demand side: Increasing number of institutional investors are committing to incorporate ESG factors into their investment analysis and decision-making processes Supply side: Constant development in issuance of sustainable instruments (green bonds, social bonds and sustainable bonds) Bloomberg Intelligence (research arm of Bloomberg) has forecasted that the global ESG assets would exceed $53 trillion by the year 2025 and would represent more than a third of the $140.5 trillion in projected total assets under management. Hence, there will be emerging investment flows to the ESG assets in the future, and if enabling frameworks are put in place to facilitate different ESG related new products and initiatives, Sri Lanka would be able to lure much needed foreign inflows to the country in going forward. Sustainable Bonds Sustainable bonds constitute financial instruments aimed at supporting sustainable development by raising capital to finance or re-finance Green or Social or Sustainability-linked projects. In general, Sustainable bonds can be distinguished from regular bonds by the specific use of the funds raised. Thus, in addition to evaluating the standard financial characteristics (such as maturity, coupon, price, and credit quality of the issuer), investors also assess the specific environmental and/or social purposes of the projects that the bonds intend to support. Types of sustainable bonds; Green Bonds Blue Bonds Climate Bonds Social Bonds Sustainability Bonds What is a Green Bond? Green bonds are innovative financial instruments where the proceeds are invested exclusively (either by specifying the use of the proceeds, direct project exposure, or securitization) in green projects that generate climate or other environmental benefits, for example in renewable energy, energy efficiency, sustainable waste management, sustainable land use (forestry and agriculture), biodiversity, clean transportation and clean water. Their structure, risk and returns are otherwise identical to those of traditional bonds. Green bonds can mobilize resources from domestic and international Capital Markets for climate change adaptation, renewables and other environment friendly projects. They are no different from conventional bonds, their only unique characteristic being the specification that the proceeds be invested in projects that generate environmental benefits. In its simplest form, a bond issuer will raise a fixed amount of capital, repaying the capital (principal) and accrued interest (coupon) over a set period of time. The issuer will need to generate sufficient cash flows to repay the interest and capital. Qualification Criteria for Green Bonds The International Capital Market Association’s (ICMA) Green Bond Principles (GBP) and the Climate Bonds Initiative's (CBI) Climate Bond Standards (CBS) help to determine whether a bond qualifies as green or not. Usually, green bonds must undergo a third party verification/certification to establish that the proceeds are funding projects that generate environmental benefits. The four Green Bonds Principles that define a green bond relate to: Use of proceeds: the issuer should declare the eligible green project categories it intends to support. It should also provide a clear definition of the environmental benefits connected to the project(s) financed by the proceeds. Process for project evaluation and selection: the issuer should outline the investment decision making process it follows to determine the eligibility of individual investments using the green bond’s proceeds. Management of proceeds: the proceeds should be moved to a sub portfolio or otherwise attested to by a formal internal process that should be disclosed. Reporting: the issuer should report at least annually on the investments made from the proceeds, detailing wherever possible the environmental benefits accrued with quantitative/qualitative indicators. Green Bond Issuances by the Emerging and Developing Economy Segment Cumulative Emerging Market Green Bond Issuances From 2012-2021 ($mn) Source: IFC Global Macro & Market Research, Bloomberg, Environmental Finance, Climate Bonds Initiative Total Return Performance of Global Green Bonds vs. Global Aggregates Source: IFC Global Macro & Market Research, Bloomberg, Environmental Finance, Climate Bonds Initiative Benefits of Issuing Green Bonds Benefits for issuers can include: Improve investor diversification Enhance issuer reputation Provide an additional source of sustainable financing Increase alignment regarding the durability of instruments and the project lifecycle Attract strong investor demand, which can lead to high oversubscription and pricing benefits Can facilitate the establishment of public private partnerships that might accelerate the pace of green investment and lead to the adoption of new technologies. Benefits for investors can include: Comparable financial returns with the addition of environmental and/or social benefits Satisfy ESG requirements for sustainable investment mandates Contribute to national climate adaptation, food security, public health, energy supply, amongst others Enable direct investment in the ‘greening’ of brown sectors and social impact activities Increased transparency and accountability on the use and management of proceeds, becoming an additional risk management tool Green bonds can help mitigate climate change-related risks in the portfolio due to changing policies such as carbon taxation which could lead to stranded assets. Instead, a green bond invests in climate-friendly assets, such as green buildings, renewable energy, that over time bear a lower credit risk. Potential for Introducing Green Financing Initiatives in Sri Lanka Presently, more corporate bodies are interested in moving towards green projects/initiatives in order to ensure sustainable development in their businesses while ensuring the protection of the environment and wellbeing of the society. Green Bonds will broad base investment opportunities available for investors and provide an avenue for the companies who are interested in engaging in green projects. This would offer investment opportunities to groups (both local and foreign) who are interested in investing in green projects which would benefit the overall Capital Market. In year 2022, the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) launched a green taxonomy in partnership with the International Finance Corporation (IFC) that defines and categorizes economic activities that are environmentally sustainable, and would aide in providing a holistic strategy to integrate sustainability into the country’s financial system. The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) is already registered under the Sustainable Stock Exchanges (SSE) initiative and is currently working on ESG related initiatives under the guidance of the Securities and Exchange Commission of Sri Lanka (SEC). The SSE initiative provides a peer to peer learning platform for exploring how exchanges in collaboration with investors, regulators, and companies can encourage sustainable investment and enhance corporate transparency, and performance on ESG. Steps Taken by the SEC for Introducing Green Bonds and Facilitating Sustainable Finance Initiatives The introduction of Green Bonds to the Sri Lankan Capital Market would enable listed entities to raise capital for Green projects adhering to international principles applicable. This would not only expand the supply side but also open up avenue for getting much needed foreign inflows to the country from foreign funds. Moreover, in June 2022 to enhance the awareness building initiatives in relation to ESG, a MOU was signed between the SEC, CSE and the Chartered Financial Analysts (CFA) Society. The MOU broadly intended to establish a collaborative relationship to promote awareness of ESG among Sri Lankan investors to enhance investor protection, encourage capital market practitioners to introduce ESG into their investment research and valuation process to keep abreast with challenging global trends and ensure that the professional standards and integrity are maintained in the Sri Lankan capital market. In August 2022, to promote ESG reporting by listed companies, the SEC, CSE and the Institute of Chartered Accountants of Sri Lanka (ICASL) entered in to a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) which broadly covered areas on building awareness on integrated reporting, corporate governance, sustainability and any other related areas for the benefit of corporates and the users of financial statements/corporate reports. In addition the SEC developed a policy and regulatory framework governing Green Bonds in consultation with Technical Experts from the Asian Development Bank (ADB) and the CSE and in April 2023, the SEC Commission approved rules for issuing Green Bonds. Presently, the CSE under the guidance of the SEC is completing the groundwork for launching a green index. A green index would help investors assess and integrate sustainable financing considerations in their investment process and portfolio.

Creating new investment opportunities and markets away from hydrocarbon will propel entrepreneurship and drive Qatar’s economic diversification ambitions, Dean of Qatar University College of Business and Economics, Prof Rana Sobh, has said. In an interview with The Peninsula, Prof Sobh noted that developing new products, services, and technology, generating new wealth, job opportunities and reduced dependence on public sector jobs are ways that the country can encourage a culture of entrepreneurship and economic independence of citizens. “Qatar’s economic diversification drive is focused on creating a more resilient and sustainable economy by reducing its reliance on the oil and gas industry and developing new industries and sectors. “The country has invested heavily in developing a knowledge-based economy, promoting tourism, developing the SMEs sector, building human capital, and investing in renewable energy. These initiatives aim at creating new jobs, businesses, and opportunities for economic growth and sustainable development,” she added. Qatar’s commitment to diversifying its economy is a top priority for the government, particularly as many investments and strategies towards boosting other sectors like tourism, communications and IT, as well as financial services, have increased. Qatar has also expanded investment in renewable energy as part of its sustainability approach and economic boost. According to Prof Sobh, Qatar is taking a crucial step towards achieving sustainable development by pursuing economic diversification. She said a more diversified economy would better withstand fluctuations in oil and gas prices and changes in global demand for fossil fuels while promoting social and environmental sustainability. She said: “This will help to ensure long-term economic growth and development, as well as create a more resilient and sustainable future for Qatar.” In 2021, Qatar was ranked ninth on the list of top countries for entrepreneurs according to the National Entrepreneurial Context Index (NECI). According to the report, Qatar’s position is strengthened due to the country’s successful national development strategies, which support and promote new businesses and especially encourage female entrepreneurs. At QU, the Center for Entrepreneurship & Organizational Excellence (CEOE) aims to impact how organisations in Qatar conduct business and how their business affects the country by conducting outstanding research and policy works, experiential learning, distinctive capacity building, and community outreach. “Given that Qatar, along with the rest of the region, is at the heart of developing a booming entrepreneurial hub that fosters sustainability and innovation, we inspire to create and apply new knowledge and to be engaged in value-added activities that contribute to enhancing organisational excellence, sustainable development and societal impact,” Prof Sobh noted.

text: INTRODUCTION 2023 has seen the emergence of a number of personal care companies in India. Many of these companies have online stores which allow customers to purchase their products easily and conveniently. These personal care companies in India offer products and services that cater to various needs. Customers can choose from brands that specialize in natural and organic products or those that focus on anti-ageing solutions or sunscreens. There are products available for every budget, so everyone can find something that meets their needs and fits their lifestyle. Many of the companies also offer advice and guidance on how to properly use their products, including tips on makeup application, hairstyling, and skincare. They also host events and workshops where customers can meet and learn from experts in the industry. In 2023, many of these companies are increasingly leveraging new technologies such as AI and machine learning to help them better understand their customer’s needs and create personalized product recommendations. This means that customers will have access to higher quality and more tailored products and services than ever before. Overall, India’s market for personal care products is continuing to grow at an impressive rate. With the emergence of new companies and the increased focus on technology and personalization, customers will have greater access to quality products and services than ever before. The Indian personal care market is expected to reach $20 billion by 2022, and this number is only expected to grow. As a result, personal care companies in India are offering products that are specialized for different demographics, with an emphasis on natural ingredients and sustainability. In addition, personal care companies are utilizing digital marketing tools to target consumers better and promote their products. Marico – Marico is a leading Indian consumer goods company that produces and distributes health, beauty, and wellness products. Marico consistently invests in R&D and advertising to strengthen its market position. The company also has a strong emphasis on corporate social responsibility and focuses on economic, environmental and social sustainability across all its operations. Marico is committed to building a better tomorrow by investing in future generations through education, skill development, and healthcare initiatives. Dabur – Dabur is an Indian consumer goods company headquartered in New Delhi, founded in 1884. It produces a wide range of products, including food and beverages, personal care items, home care products, health supplements, and ayurvedic medicines. Dabur’s flagship product is its honey, which is sourced from bees across India. The company also has a wide network of retail stores across the country. Colgate-Palmolive – Colgate-Palmolive is a global consumer goods company based in New York City. The company’s products are sold in over 200 countries and territories around the world. Godrej Consumer Products – Godrej Consumer Products is a leading Indian-based multinational conglomerate company with a presence in many countries around the world. Jyothy Laboratories – Jyothy Laboratories is a leading Indian consumer goods company that produces a wide range of products, including fabric and home care items, personal care products, mosquito repellents and pest control solutions. text: INTRODUCTION Waste management in India has become a significant concern in the 21st century. In 2023, many companies will be providing waste management services in India to help reduce the waste created by individuals and businesses. These companies provide services such as recycling and collection, composting, incineration, landfilling, and other waste disposal methods. Recycling is one of the critical methods waste management companies use in India. It involves collecting and sorting materials such as paper, plastic, glass, and metal and then reusing or transforming them into new products. Collection and composting are also essential for reducing waste. Composting involves breaking down organic material into a nutrient-rich soil amendment, which can be used for gardening or landscaping. In addition to these methods, some companies also provide energy recovery processes such as incineration, which involves burning solid waste to generate heat and electricity. Landfilling is another standard method that involves burying garbage in an enclosed space. Finally, some companies in India also carry out hazardous waste management to help ensure that dangerous materials do not harm the environment. Overall, many different waste management companies in India in 2023 are dedicated to helping reduce the amount of waste produced. By using their services, individuals and businesses can help reduce the environmental impact while still enjoying the convenience of properly disposing of their waste. IMPORTANCE Waste management has become increasingly important in India in the past few years. The country faces many challenges related to waste disposalcluding air pollution, water contamination, land degradation, and public health issues. In 2023, waste management companies will be critical players in helping to address these issues. Waste management companies provide services such as collection, transportation, sorting, recycling, and disposal of waste materials. These companies work closely with government agencies and other stakeholders to reduce the amount of waste produced, divert it from landfills, and recycle or reuse materials. Waste management companies are also focused on providing sustainable solutions to waste management problems, and they are committed to reducing their carbon footprint and investing in renewable energy sources. The growth in India’s population and urbanization has resulted in increased amounts of waste being generated. This, combined with poor infrastructure and limited resources, makes efficient waste management even more critical. Companies must ensure that the right processes and technologies are in place to manage waste effectively. Waste management companies are at the forefront of identifying and implementing these solutions. In addition, waste management companies are working to increase awareness among consumers about ways to reduce and responsibly dispose of their waste. Education initiatives and campaigns are being conducted to educate people about the importance of proper waste disposal and how recycling can help protect the environment. In 2023, waste management companies in India will continue to play an important role in tackling the country’s waste management problems. With the right strategies, processes, and technologies in place, these companies can help create a cleaner and healthier environment for everyone. Here are the top 10 best waste management companies in India in 2023 Clean India Initiative – The Clean India Initiative company is a non-profit organization dedicated to promoting cleanliness and sanitation throughout India. The company was founded in 2020 in response to the rising levels of pollution and poor sanitation that were having an impact on India’s health and environment. The mission of the company is to raise awareness about the importance of cleanliness and hygiene, develop innovative solutions to improve sanitation standards and advocate for policies to reduce waste and conserve resources. The company works with governmental agencies, local governments, businesses, and civil society organizations to achieve its goals. Clean India Initiative has implemented several programs to spread awareness about the need for improved sanitation. These include: • A nationwide campaign to promote the use of toilets and latrines • Promoting the reuse and recycling of waste materials • Facilitating access to sanitation services in remote areas • Training communities in safe disposal of human waste • Organizing workshops and seminars to discuss best practices in sanitation • Developing new technologies to improve water and sanitation systems • Supporting research on sanitation and waste management The Clean India Initiative is committed to bringing about positive change in India through its work. It aims to create a cleaner, healthier, and more sustainable future for India by working with various stakeholders and lobbying for policy change. The organization has been praised for its innovative approaches to tackling India’s sanitation problems, and it continues to strive towards its goal of making India a truly clean country. Swachh Bharat Abhiyan – The Swachh Bharat Abhiyan Company was established in 2019 as part of the Indian government’s Clean India mission. The company is dedicated to creating a cleaner, healthier, and more sustainable environment in India. It has four main goals: improving solid waste management, ensuring access to safe sanitation, increasing public awareness of proper hygiene, and promoting sustainable development. The company works with government departments, local communities, nonprofit organizations, and private businesses to achieve its objectives. Its main focus is on strengthening existing infrastructure and developing new strategies for managing solid waste and improving sanitation. The company has also initiated various programs to promote public health, including campaigns for proper handwashing, distributing pamphlets about proper hygiene, and providing education about water conservation. The company has been successful in providing resources for households and communities to improve sanitation and waste management. They have established hundreds of toilets, dustbins, and compost pits around the country. They have also created a network of community volunteers who help people adopt better practices. In addition, they have developed several short-term awareness campaigns to educate people about the importance of cleanliness. The company also works with other organizations to provide technical assistance and advice on ways to reduce pollution further and create a healthier environment. As part of their long-term vision, they are working to develop more efficient waste collection systems and sustainable energy projects. They are currently in the process of setting up treatment centres for wastewater and garbage. Overall, the Swachh Bharat Abhiyan Company has been instrumental in helping India move towards a cleaner and more sustainable future. Their efforts have helped to improve the lives of millions of people by providing access to basic amenities and reducing environmental degradation. E-Waste Management India Pvt Ltd – E-Waste Management India Pvt Ltd is a company dedicated to the safe and responsible disposal of end-of-life electronics. The company works closely with both governmental and private entities to ensure that all waste is disposed of safely and responsibly. They have developed comprehensive processes for the collection, sorting, dismantling, and recycling of electronic waste, as well as measures to address issues related to air and water pollution, hazardous substances, and human safety. Their activities are in compliance with Indian as well as international laws. The company provides services such as collection of e-waste from sources such as households, businesses, and industries; sorting and segregation of e-waste into categories such as plastics, metals, and other materials; dismantling the equipment into their component parts; and proper disposal or recycling of these materials. The company also offers consultancy services to help organizations and individuals comply with the existing environmental legislation. In addition to providing collection, sorting, and disposal services, E-Waste Management India Pvt Ltd also provides education and awareness activities to promote responsible and sustainable consumption of electronic products. They offer guidance on safe handling and disposal of electronic products and organize workshops to teach people about the importance of e-waste management and how it can benefit the environment. E-Waste Management India Pvt Ltd has a strict policy of ensuring the safety and welfare of workers employed in its operations. All staff members receive extensive training to ensure that all company activities are conducted in a safe and responsible manner. They also make sure that all workers are provided with the necessary safety equipment and protective clothing. This reduces the risk of exposure to hazardous materials which can be present in e-waste. The company has taken numerous steps to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of its operations. It has invested heavily in modern technology and processes to reduce the amount of time spent on manual sorting and to increase accuracy in waste categorization. This has resulted in more efficient and less time-consuming waste processing. E-Waste Management India Pvt Ltd is committed to minimizing the environmental impact of its activities. It regularly monitors its operations and makes sure that all processes are carried out in line with the applicable regulations. The company also strives to innovate and develop new technologies and processes, which will lead to an even better performance in terms of sustainability. The Bhumi Project – The Bhumi Project Company is an international, non-profit organization that works to build a sustainable future for people and the planet. It was founded in 2018 with a mission to create a world of shared abundance and social justice through the use of innovative technology, sustainable business models and education. The company has since grown to include a network of entrepreneurs, investors, researchers and experts from around the world. Bhumi Project’s core areas of impact are energy, water, food, waste, health, education and economic development. By using cutting-edge technology solutions, it helps address global challenges in these areas. Its projects are designed to have real-world impact and transformation, creating lasting social and environmental benefits for local communities. On the energy front, Bhumi Project is working to make solar energy more accessible to marginalized communities. It has partnered with local governments and industry leaders to promote access to clean, renewable energy sources and reduce the burden of expensive energy bills. It also invests in research and development to develop more efficient and low-cost solar solutions. In terms of water, Bhumi Project has developed cost-effective solutions to bring clean and safe drinking water to communities lacking access to clean water. For food security, Bhumi Project develops agriculture and food production technologies to improve yields and reduce the amount of land needed for farming. It also works to increase access to healthy, nutritious and locally produced foods, ensuring that families living in poverty can have access to an adequate diet. When it comes to health, Bhumi Project works to improve access to healthcare for the most vulnerable members of society. It focuses on developing mobile health devices and monitoring systems to provide remote care for those who lack access to traditional medical services. Finally, Bhumi Project also works to provide educational opportunities for children in need. It has partnered with schools, universities and other organizations to provide better access to education and reduce disparities in educational outcomes. Through its efforts, Bhumi Project aims to create a world where everyone can access basic resources and opportunities to thrive. Greener Pastures India – Greener Pastures India Company is a leading renewable energy and infrastructure development firm based in Chennai, India. The company specializes in developing, installing and operating large-scale solar plants, wind farms, biomass projects and other renewable projects across India. It also provides end-to-end engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) services. Greener Pastures has already delivered more than 100 megawatts of clean energy and is the first company in India to develop, own, and operate its own grid-scale solar power plant. The company was founded in 2016 by Chirag Jhaveri and Dinesh Kulkarni as a joint venture between Greener Pastures Group and ReNew Power Ventures Pvt. Ltd. Greener Pastures India Company has a team of over 200 professionals and technicians, and a strong network of global partners and suppliers to deliver innovative, reliable and cost-effective solutions for its customers. In addition to developing its own solar projects, Greener Pastures India Company also offers project finance, asset management and other services to help its clients maximize their return on investment. The company has developed an extensive network of contractors and experts in the industry that it regularly works with to ensure its projects meet all applicable standards and regulations. Greener Pastures India Company seeks to improve the lives of people living in rural areas and local communities by providing them with access to affordable, reliable and clean energy. The company is committed to providing the highest quality of service and ensuring the safety of its workers and environment. Greener Pastures India Company understands the importance of sustainability and is actively working towards reducing its carbon footprint and promoting renewable energy sources. Recycleneem India – Recycleneem India is a leading provider of advanced recycling solutions that enable businesses to reduce their environmental impact while increasing profitability. The company offers innovative solutions for a range of industries, from automotive and electronics to packaging and paper. Recycleneem India has developed a unique process which breaks down discarded materials into reusable components. This proprietary process uses high-temperature furnaces to separate the waste materials into their individual parts, which are then reassembled into new products. The company uses state-of-the-art technology and equipment to ensure that all recycled materials are of the highest quality. Furthermore, they employ a wide variety of sorting techniques to maximize the reuse potential of each item. In addition to its core recycling activities, Recycleneem India also offers related services such as collection, transportation, storage, and disposal of non-recyclable waste. They are committed to providing their customers with the most efficient and cost-effective solutions for their recycling needs. Ultimately, Recycleneem India seeks to reduce environmental pollution and create sustainable solutions for managing waste. Srishti Eco Solutions – SRISHTI ECO SOLUTIONS is a company that specializes in providing eco-friendly solutions to everyday problems. Founded in 2023, the company has grown rapidly and has a presence in multiple countries around the world. They offer a range of eco-friendly services such as: waste management, energy efficiency solutions, renewable energy solutions, water conservation solutions, green building solutions, environmental sustainability solutions and more. Their aim is to reduce the environmental impacts of human activities by improving their sustainability and efficiency. They have developed innovative technologies such as solar energy for heating and cooling, energy-efficient appliances and electric vehicles to help businesses meet their sustainability goals. In addition, they have been helping local communities implement sustainable practices for water conservation and waste management. They have also set up numerous projects to promote awareness about environmental protection and its importance. Moreover, SRISHTI ECO SOLUTIONS has partnered with numerous organizations in order to work together in creating an environmentally sustainable future. They are committed to make their solutions available to all so that everyone can benefit from them. Their mission is to become a leader in providing eco-friendly solutions to people’s everyday needs and to be a positive force for change in the world. Green Revolution India – Green Revolution India Company is a leading agricultural technology and services provider in India. They provide farmers with access to innovative farm input technologies, enabling them to increase their productivity and incomes. Through their products and services, they enable farmers to reduce the environmental impact of their farming practices. The company’s primary focus is on providing modern and sustainable agricultural solutions, such as precision farming, water management and crop protection. They also offer training and support to help farmers adopt best practices and embrace new technologies. Green Revolution India Company provides critical support to the rural population, making sure that farmers have access to the latest technologies and information. This helps them to improve their yields and incomes, while also reducing the environmental impact of their farming practices. Enviro India – Enviro India is a leading renewable energy and sustainability solutions provider based in New Delhi, India. Founded in 2020, the company has grown quickly to become one of India’s premier renewable energy companies. Enviro India provides comprehensive services that cover all aspects of renewable energy, including resource assessment, project development, construction management, procurement, operation, and maintenance. Their products range from solar photovoltaic systems to wind turbines, biogas plants, and fuel cells. The company offers a variety of services that help make renewable energy projects cost-effective, sustainable, and resilient. In addition, they provide technical assistance and training for their clients. Enviro India has an impressive portfolio of successful projects, ranging from large-scale solar farms to small-scale rooftop installations. They also specialize in the design and installation of off-grid projects such as home and commercial solar systems. They are dedicated to advancing the use of renewable energy sources in India and promoting clean and sustainable development. Enviro India works with local communities, governments, and businesses to ensure that their projects are socially, economically, and environmentally beneficial. Waste Warriors India – Waste Warriors India is a waste management company based in India. Founded by two young entrepreneurs, Shubhendu Sharma and Ritesh Mishra, in 2009, the company helps households, communities, and businesses reduce their environmental impact by reducing, reusing, and recycling waste. Waste Warriors India works with companies to create zero-waste systems and help them become more sustainable. The company also provides communities with access to clean energy, sanitation, and education. They even work with schools to provide educational workshops on sustainability. Waste Warriors India employs a team of trained staff, who are committed to helping individuals, communities, and businesses to reduce their carbon footprint and protect the environment. In addition to its activities in India, Waste Warriors India has expanded its operations to Nepal, Bhutan, and Bangladesh. By 2023, the company hopes to have a presence in 10 countries across South Asia. In its efforts to reduce plastic waste, Waste Warriors India has partnered with several organizations such as UN Environment and the World Economic Forum. Together, they are developing innovative solutions to tackle the global plastic epidemic. CONCLUSION In 2023, waste management companies in India have made great strides towards a greener and more sustainable future. Through increased recycling, composting, and better treatment of hazardous materials, these companies are reducing the amount of waste that goes to landfills and improving air quality. They are also working to educate the public about waste management and the importance of proper disposal. In addition, the government is providing incentives to help businesses reduce their environmental impact. As a result, India has become a leader in waste management and is setting an example for other countries to follow.
